intro: Amblostoma densum, commonly known as the dense-stemmed amblostoma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and vegetables such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its dense, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually compound, with finely divided lobes that give it a delicate appearance. Amblostoma densum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats.
